views.explorer.name: Liberty Dashboard
views.welcome.message:
1. If no projects are open in the VS Code Explorer, open or create a Liberty project using the File menu.
[Open Project](command:vscode.openFolder) 
 2. If there is one or more existing Maven or Gradle projects open in the VS Code Explorer, try one of the following:
 a. Configure the Liberty build plugin in the build file of an existing Maven or Gradle project. [Click here for more Maven info](https://github.com/OpenLiberty/ci.maven/#configuration) or [Click here for more Gradle info.](https://github.com/OpenLiberty/ci.gradle#adding-the-plugin-to-the-build-script)
 b. Add a server.xml file to an existing Maven or Gradle project at “src/main/liberty/config”. [Click here for more info.](https://openliberty.io/docs/latest/reference/config/server-configuration-overview.html#server-xml)
 c. Manually add an existing Maven or Gradle project to the Liberty Dashboard through the VS Code command palette action “Liberty: Add project to Liberty Dashboard”.
 [Add project to Liberty Dashboard](command:liberty.dev.add.project)
